about_the_game:
A tile-based puzzle game with a twist: you can't control your robot directly, you must program it with a crude and cruelly limited programming language. Build your programs out of a custom language created for this game, navigate obstacles, obtain trophies, and keep your robots from falling into pits.

Add words to your program by pressing the editor with the mouse. Click the EXECUTE button when you are ready to see the results. The robot will do EXACTLY what you instruct it to do, for good or for ill.

What could possibly go wrong?

Features:

* 25+ levels!
* Execute dozens of instructions per second!
* Over 20 pits for your robots to fall into!
* Built-in debugger in case of the very unlikely possibility that you make any programming errors.
* Over 16 colors!
* Control up to three robots at once!
* A tutorial so intuitive the creator's mom could do it (with a little help)!

ABOUT THE DEMO:

The demo is functionally identical to the main game. It contains the same features and levels as the priced version. It is suggested that you try the demo for free and only buy if you enjoy it.

linux_requirements.minimum:
Minimum:
  • OS: Ubuntu 16.04+
  • Processor: 2GHz +
  • Memory: 1 GB RAM
  • Graphics: ATI Radeon X1300/NVIDIA GeForce 6600 GT/Intel HD 3000 or better
  • Storage: 100 MB available space
  • Sound Card: Intel High Definition Audio

mac_requirements.minimum:
Minimum:
  • OS: 11.7 or newer
  • Processor: Only tested on intel chips
  • Memory: 1 GB RAM
  • Graphics: Integrated graphics
  • Storage: 100 MB available space
  • Sound Card: Intel High Definition Audio

name: Frood Robotics

pc_requirements.minimum:
Minimum:
  • Requires a 64-bit processor and operating system
  • OS: Windows 10
  • Processor: 2GHz +
  • Memory: 1 GB RAM
  • Graphics: ATI Radeon X1300/NVIDIA GeForce 6600 GT/Intel HD 3000 or better
  • Storage: 100 MB available space
  • Sound Card: Intel High Definition Audio
pc_requirements.recommended:
Recommended:
  • Requires a 64-bit processor and operating system

short_description: Get your robot to the trophy! The catch: you can't control the robot directly, you must program it with a crude and cruelly limited programming language. Avoid pits, press buttons, and remember, if it's a bug but it works, then it is not a bug.
